sen.j: 日本 >近畿地方 > 北近畿
sen.e: Japan >Kinki Region > Kitakinki
Japan >Kinki Region > Kitakinki
Japan >Kinki Region > Kitakinki

sen.j: 北近畿（きたきんき）とは、近畿地方の日本海側を指す。
sen.e: Kitakinki refers to Japan sea coastal areas.
Kitakinki refers to Japan sea coastal areas.
Kitakinki refers to Japan sea coastal areas.

sen.j: 狭義では、京都府北部（旧丹波国の大半、旧丹後国）と兵庫県北部（旧但馬国、旧丹波国の一部）を指す。
sen.e: It is narrowly defined as an area that covers the most of northern Kyoto Prefecture (former Tango Provinces and most parts of former Tanba Province) and northern Hyogo prefecture (former Tajima Province and a part of Tanba Province).

It is narrowly defined as an area that covers the most of northern Kyoto Prefecture (former Tango Provinces and most parts of former Tanba Province) and northern Hyogo prefecture (former Tajima Province and a part of Tanba Province).

It is narrowly defined as an area that covers the northern Kyoto Prefecture (former Tango Province and most parts of former Tanba Province) and northern Hyogo Prefecture (former Tajima Province and a part of Tanba Province).
sen.cmt: Tanba → Tango に修正しました。

sen.j: これらの地域は、令制国でいう丹波国・丹後国・但馬国に当たる地域である。
sen.e: These regions correspond to Tanba Province, Tango Province, and Tajima Province of an ancient administrative division.
These regions correspond to the Tanba Province, Tango Province, and Tajima Province from an ancient administrative division.
These regions correspond to the Tanba Province, Tango Province, and Tajima Province from an ancient administrative division.

sen.j: ただし、丹波国でも京都市や大阪との繋がりが強い京都府亀岡市や南丹市、船井郡京丹波町は南丹又は口丹と呼ばれ外されている。
sen.e: However, Kameoka City Kyoto Prefecture, Nantan City and Kyotanba-cho Funai-gun in Tanba Province are not included in Kitakinki and belong to provinces called Nantan or Kuchitan, because the regions have a close tie with Kyoto City and Osaka.

However, Kameoka City Kyoto Prefecture, Nantan City and Kyotanba-cho Funai-gun in Tanba Province are not included in Kitakinki and belong to provinces called Nantan or Kuchitan, because the regions have a close tie with Kyoto City and Osaka.

However, Kameoka City, Nantan City and Kyotanba-cho, Funai-gun in Kyoto Prefecture are not included in Kitakinki but instead called Nantan or Kuchitan even though they are within the Tanba Province, because the regions have a close tie with Kyoto City and Osaka.
sen.cmt: 語順を変更しました（亀岡市、南丹市、船井郡が全て京都にある、という表現にしました）。

sen.j: これらの地域には、山陰海岸国立公園や城崎温泉、日本三景の一つ天橋立などの名勝を抱えており、夏には海水浴を、冬にはカニ料理を目的とした観光客が多く訪れている。
sen.e: These regions have places of scenic beauty such as Sanin-Kaigan National Park, Kinosaki Hot Spring, and Amonohashidate--one of the Three Great Views of Japan, which attract many tourists enjoying seaside resorts in summer and craving for crab dishes in winter.

These regions have scenic places such as Sanin-Kaigan National Park, Kinosaki Hot Spring, and Amonohashidate--one of the Three Great Views of Japan, which attract many tourists who enjoy seaside resorts in summer and crab dishes in winter.

These regions have scenic places such as Sanin-Kaigan National Park, Kinosaki Hot Spring, and Amonohashidate--one of the Three Great Views of Japan, which attract many tourists who enjoy seaside resorts in summer and crab dishes in winter.

sen.j: 京都府北部と兵庫県北部の自治体は、観光事業の促進のために北近畿広域観光連盟を結成している。
sen.e: Municipalities in northern Kyoto Prefecture and Northern Hyogo Prefecture have formed the Kitakinki Wide Area Tourist Federation to promote the sightseeing businesses in the regions..
Municipalities in northern Kyoto Prefecture and Northern Hyogo Prefecture have formed the Kitakinki Wide Area Tourist Federation to promote sightseeing businesses in the regions..
Municipalities in northern Kyoto Prefecture and Northern Hyogo Prefecture have formed the Kitakinki Wide Area Tourist Federation to promote sightseeing businesses in the regions..

sen.j: 広義では、福井県南部（嶺南）、或いは福井県全域を含める場合もある。
sen.e: Kitakinki, in a boarder sense, includes the southern Fukui Prefecture (Reinan) or the entire area of Fukui Prefecture.
Kitakinki, in a boarder sense, includes the southern Fukui Prefecture (Reinan) or the entire area of Fukui Prefecture.
Kitakinki, in a boarder sense, includes the southern Fukui Prefecture (Reinan) or the entire area of Fukui Prefecture.

sen.j: 嶺南は、概ね令制国の若狭国に相当し、古くから舞鶴市、米原市、京都市との繋がりも深い。
sen.e: Reinan, which almost corresponds to Wakasa Province of an ancient administrative division, has had close connections with Maizuru City, Maibara City, and Kyoto City since ancient times.
Reinan, which almost corresponds to Wakasa Province of an ancient administrative division, has had close connections with Maizuru City, Maibara City, and Kyoto City since ancient times.
Reinan, which almost corresponds to Wakasa Province of an ancient administrative division, has had close connections with Maizuru City, Maibara City, and Kyoto City since ancient times.

sen.j: 北近畿の開発事業を促進する北近畿開発促進協議会には、この福井県嶺南の自治体も参加している。
sen.e: Municipalities in this Reinan of Fukui Prefecture join Kitakinki Development and Promotion Committee, which plays an role of promoting development projects in Kitakinki.
Municipalities in Reinan of Fukui Prefecture are also involved in the Kitakinki Development and Promotion Committee, which plays a role in promoting development projects within Kitakinki.
Municipalities in Reinan of Fukui Prefecture are also involved in the Kitakinki Development and Promotion Committee, which plays a role in promoting development projects within Kitakinki.

sen.j: 舞鶴には第八管区海上保安本部が置かれており、兵庫県北部・京都府北部・福井県全域の沖合いを管轄しており、若狭湾沿岸の全域がこのエリアに含まれている。
sen.e: The 8th Regional Coast Guard Headquarters, located at Maizuru Port, has a jurisdiction over the sea off northern Hyogo Prefecture, northern Kyoto Prefecture, and entire Fukui Prefecture, which means the entire area off the coast of Wakasa Bay.

The 8th Regional Coast Guard Headquarters, located at Maizuru Port, has jurisdiction over the sea off northern Hyogo Prefecture, northern Kyoto Prefecture, and entire Fukui Prefecture, encompassing the entire area off the coast of Wakasa Bay.

The Eighth Regional Coast Guard Headquarters, located at Maizuru Port, has jurisdiction over the sea off northern Hyogo Prefecture, northern Kyoto Prefecture, and entire Fukui Prefecture, encompassing the entire area off the coast of Wakasa Bay.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 日本海に面しており、気候は日本海側気候が見られるが、冬の雪は北陸程は多くはなく、雨の日が比較的多い。
sen.e: Kitakinki, which faces Japan Sea, shows a Japan-Sea side climate pattern but has less snow than Hokoriku and instead has a lot of rainy days.
Kitakinki, which faces the Japan Sea, shows a Japan-Sea side climate pattern but has less snow than Hokoriku and instead has many rainy days.
Kitakinki, which faces the Japan Sea, shows a Japan-Sea side climate pattern but has less snow than Hokoriku and instead has many rainy days.

sen.j: このため、「弁当忘れても傘忘れるな」という格言が存在する。
sen.e: A local proverb says: "Do not forget your umbrella even if you forget your lunch box."
A local proverb says: "Do not forget your umbrella even if you forget your lunch box."
A local proverb says: 'Do not forget your umbrella even if you forget your lunch box.'

sen.j: 海岸：若狭湾、天橋立
sen.e: Seaside: Wakasa Bay, Amanohashidate
Seaside: Wakasa Bay, Amanohashidate
Seaside: Wakasa Bay, Amanohashidate

sen.j: 温泉：城崎温泉
sen.e: Hot Spring: Kinosaki Hot Spring
Hot Spring: Kinosaki Hot Spring
Hot Spring: Kinosaki Hot Spring

sen.j: 川：遠敷川、由良川
sen.e: River: Onyu-gawa River, Yura-gawa River
River: Onyu-gawa River, Yura-gawa River
River: Onyu-gawa River, Yura-gawa River

sen.j: 湖：三方五湖
sen.e: Lake: Mikatagoko Lake
Lake: Mikatagoko Lake
Lake: Mikatagoko Lake

sen.j: 山：愛発山、青葉山 (京都府・福井県)、五老岳、大江山、氷ノ山
sen.e: Mountain: Arachi-yama Mountain, Mt. Aoba (Kyoto and Fukui Prefectures), Gorogadake Mountain, Oe-yama Mountain, Hyonosen Mountain
Mountain: Arachi-yama Mountain, Mt. Aoba (Kyoto and Fukui Prefectures), Gorogadake Mountain, Oe-yama Mountain, Hyonosen Mountain
Mountain: Mt. Arachi, Mt. Aoba (Kyoto and Fukui Prefectures), Mt. Gorogadake, Oe-yama mountain range, Mt. Hyono
sen.cmt: Mt. の表記に統一しました。大江山のみ、Oe-yama mountain range としました。

sen.j: 盆地：福知山盆地、豊岡盆地
sen.e: Basin:Fukuchiyama Basin, Toyooka Basin
Basin:Fukuchiyama Basin, Toyooka Basin
Basin:Fukuchiyama Basin, Toyooka Basin

sen.j: 高地：丹波高地
sen.e: Highland: Tamba Highland
Highland: Tamba Highland
Highland: Tanba Highland

sen.j: 半島：丹後半島
sen.e: Peninsula: Tango Peninsula
Peninsula: Tango Peninsula
Peninsula: Tango Peninsula

sen.j: 古代の北近畿には、丹国や若狭国造といった地方王国が分立していた。
sen.e: Ancient Kitakinki was divided into districts each of which was governed by a local kingdoms such as Ninokuni and Wakasa Kokuzo regional administrator Ancient Kitakinki.
Ancient Kitakinki was divided into districts each of which was governed by local kingdoms such as Ninokuni and Wakasa Kokuzo regional administrator Ancient Kitakinki.
Ancient Kitakinki was divided into districts each of which was governed by local kingdoms such as Ninokuni and Wakasa Kokuzo regional administrator.
sen.cmt: ダブりを削除しました。

sen.j: これらの地方王国は、北陸地方（越国）や山陰地方（因幡国、出雲国など）や北部九州（筑紫国、末盧国など）の地方王国と共に、日本海沿岸の一大勢力を築いていた。
sen.e: These local kingdoms, along with counterparts of Hokuriku District (Koshi Province),, Sanin Region (Inaba Province and Izumo Province), Northern Kyushu (Tsukushi Province and Matsura Kingdom), had a great influence throughout Japan Sea side of Japan.

These local kingdoms, along with counterparts of Hokuriku District (Koshi Province), Sanin Region (Inaba Province and Izumo Province), Northern Kyushu (Tsukushi Province and Matsura Kingdom), had great influence throughout the Japan Sea side of Japan.

These local kingdoms, along with counterparts of Hokuriku region (Koshi Province), Sanin region (Inaba Province and Izumo Province), Northern Kyushu (Tsukushi Province and Matsura Kingdom), had great influence throughout the Japan Sea side of Japan.

sen.j: その中でも丹国は、のちのヤマト王権に並ぶ独立性を持っていたとする説（丹後王国論）があるように、大陸との交易により力を備えていたと考えられている。
sen.e: In particular Ninokuni is considered to have secured power through trade with the Chinese continent, just as a theory (Tango Kingdom theory) says that the kingdom was independent from the Yamato Dynasty, which was established later.

In particular Ninokuni is thought to have secured power through trade with the Chinese continent. One theory (Tango Kingdom theory) says that the kingdom was independent from the Yamato Dynasty, which was established later.

In particular Ninokuni is thought to have secured power through trade with the Chinese continent; one theory (Tango Kingdom theory) says that the kingdom was as independent as Yamato Dynasty, which was established later.

sen.j: 伊勢神宮が現在の伊勢市に移る前には、元伊勢が大江山の近くに鎮座していた。
sen.e: Moto-ise had been enshrined near Oe-yama Mountain before it was relocated to the present-day Ise City
Moto-ise had been enshrined near Oe-yama Mountain before it was relocated to present-day Ise City
Moto-ise had been enshrined near Oe-yama mountain range before it was relocated to present-day Ise City.
sen.cmt: Oe-yama mountain range としました。ピリオドを追加しました。

tit.e: Age of Kinai (territories in the vicinity of the capital and under direct imperial rule.
Age of Kinai (territories in the vicinity of the capital and under direct imperial rule.)
Age of Kinai (territories in the vicinity of the capital and under direct imperial rule) administration
tit.cmt: 政権 を追加しました。

sen.j: 奈良盆地でヤマト王権が勢力を拡大すると、北近畿の地方王国はヤマト王権に恭順し、北近畿はヤマト王権の北の入口となった。
sen.e: When the Yamato Dynasty expanded its power in the Nara Basin, local kingdoms in Kitakinnki showed allegiance to the Yamato Dynasty, making Kitakinnki the north entrance of Yamato Dynasty.
When the Yamato Dynasty expanded its power in the Nara Basin, local kingdoms in Kitakinnki showed allegiance to the Yamato Dynasty, making Kitakinnki the north entrance of Yamato Dynasty.
When the Yamato Dynasty expanded its power in the Nara Basin, local kingdoms in Kitakinki showed allegiance to the Yamato Dynasty, making Kitakinki the north entrance of Yamato Dynasty.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 丹国は、丹波国と丹後国と但馬国に三分割されていた。
sen.e: Ninokuni was divided into three provinces--Tanba Province, Tango Province, and Tajima Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ninokuni was divided into three provinces--Tanba Province, Tango Province, and Tajima Province.
Ninokuni was divided into three provinces--Tanba Province, Tango Province, and Tajima Province.

sen.j: 丹波国府は元伊勢から離れた場所で、山城国に極めて近い亀岡市に置かれた。
sen.e: The ancient provincial offices of Tanba were located in Kameoka City far from Moto-ise but quite close to Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The ancient provincial offices of Tanba were located in Kameoka City far from Moto-ise but quite close to Yamashiro Province.
The ancient provincial offices of Tanba were located in Kameoka City far from Moto-ise but quite close to Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 中でも若狭国は、畿内に近い要衝として、サバなどの海産物を畿内に輸送していたため、「御食国（みけつくに）」の一角となった。
sen.e: In particular Wakasa provinces played an important role as a fortress near Kinai and "Miketsukuni"--a supplier of food to the royal family with food, because it transported its food to Kinai.
In particular Wakasa provinces played an important role as a fortress near Kinai and "Miketsukuni"--which transported food to Kinai and supplied the royal family,

In particular Wakasa Province played an important role as a fortress near Kinai and part of 'Miketsukuni'--which transported food to Kinai and supplied the royal family--as it transported seafood such as mackerel to Kinai area.
sen.cmt: Wakasa Provinceとしました。翻訳を追加しました。

tit.j: 戦国時代から江戸時代
tit.e: From the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) through the Edo Period
From the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) through the Edo Period
From the Sengoku period (period of warring states) through the Edo period
tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に変更しました。

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)には、守護の細川氏が弱体化した丹波地方にはかつての細川氏の被官であった国人領主がそれぞれ割拠した。
sen.e: In the Sengoku Period (Japan), Kokujin (indigenous persons),once high ranking officials of Hosokawa clan, controlled their own territories within Tanba after Shugo (provincial constable) became weak.

During the Sengoku Period (Japan), Kokujin (indigenous persons),once high ranking officials of Hosokawa clan, controlled their own territories within Tanba after Shugo (provincial constable) weakened.

During the Sengoku period (Japan), local samurai lords, once high ranking officials of Hosokawa clan who was a shugo (military governor) in the area, controlled their own territories within Tanba Province after Hosokawa clan had weakened.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 若狭・丹後地方は守護の武田氏と旧守護の一色氏が抗争をつづけたものの共に内紛により弱体化していった。
sen.e: In Wakasa and Tamba regions, conflicts between Takeda clan and former Shugo, Isshiki clan continued but the both clans weakened because of their internal disputes.,
In the Wakasa and Tamba regions, conflicts between the Takeda clan and former Shugo, Isshiki clan continued but both clans weakened due to their internal disputes.,
In the Wakasa and Tanba regions, conflicts between the Takeda clan and Isshiki clan who was a former shugo continued but both clans weakened due to their internal disputes.

sen.j: 畿内において織田信長が台頭し政治の実権を握るとそれらの勢力は駆逐され、信長の配下の丹羽長秀、明智光秀、細川幽斎などが北近畿を支配するようになる。
sen.e: When Nobunaga ODA emerged and seized political power in Kinai, these clans were expelled and instead Nagahide NIWA, Mitsuhide AKECHI and Yusai HOSOKAWA under Nobunaga ODA became the ruler of Kitakinki.
When Nobunaga ODA emerged and seized political power in Kinai, the clans were expelled and instead Nagahide NIWA, Mitsuhide AKECHI and Yusai HOSOKAWA under Nobunaga ODA became the ruler of Kitakinki.
When Nobunaga ODA emerged and seized political power in Kinai, the clans were expelled and instead Nagahide NIWA, Mitsuhide AKECHI and Yusai HOSOKAWA under Nobunaga ODA became the ruler of Kitakinki.

sen.j: 本能寺の変で信長が斃れると、代わって台頭した豊臣秀吉により光秀は倒され長秀と藤孝は臣従し、北近畿は豊臣政権の支配の下に再配分された。
sen.e: After the Honnoji Incident where Nobunaga was killed, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMU boated Mitsuhide and Nagahide, and Fujitaka rendered homage and service to Hideyoshi; Kitakinki was divided again under the Toyotomi administration.

After the Honnoji Incident where Nobunaga was killed, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMU boated Mitsuhide and Nagahide, and Fujitaka rendered homage and service to Hideyoshi; Kitakinki was divided again under the Toyotomi administration.

After the Honnoji Incident where Nobunaga was killed, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI brought down Mitsuhide, and Nagahide, and Fujitaka rendered homage and service to Hideyoshi; Kitakinki was divided again under the Toyotomi administration.
sen.cmt: 倒す→bring down としました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 秀吉没後の関ヶ原の戦いにおいては、北近畿は田辺城の戦いなど激戦地域の一つとなる。
sen.e: In the Battle of Skigahara after the death of Hideyoshi, Kitaknnki became one of the fierce battle fields, for instance the Battle of Tanabe-jo.
In the Battle of Sekigahara after the death of Hideyoshi, Kitakinki became site of many fierce battles, including the Battle of Tanabe-jo.
In the Battle of Sekigahara after the death of Hideyoshi, Kitakinki became site of many fierce battles, including the Battle of Tanabe-jo Castle.

sen.j: 江戸時代に入ると、北近畿には、宮津藩、小浜藩、丹後田辺藩、福知山藩、綾部藩、篠山藩、豊岡藩、出石藩といった小さな藩が分立した。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, Kitakinnki was divided and controlled by small clans such as Miyazu clan, Obama clan, Tango Tanabe clan, Fukuchiyama clan, Ayabe clan, Sasayama clan, Toyooka clan, and Izushi clan.

In the Edo Period, Kitakinnki was divided and controlled by small clans such as the Miyazu clan, Obama clan, Tango Tanabe clan, Fukuchiyama clan, Ayabe clan, Sasayama clan, Toyooka clan, and Izushi clan.

In the Edo period, Kitakinki was divided and controlled by small clans such as the Miyazu clan, Obama clan, Tango Tanabe clan, Fukuchiyama clan, Ayabe clan, Sasayama clan, Toyooka clan, and Izushi clan.

sen.j: 杞柳（こりやなぎ）製品から始まった豊岡市の鞄、綾部市の紡績業といった地場産業には、この時期に興った物もある。
sen.e: Some local industries of this region began during this Period; for example bags of Toyooka City, which started with Salix koriyanagi product, and the spinning of Ayabe City.
Some local industries in this region began during this Period; for example bags produced within Toyooka City, which started with the product Salix koriyanagi, and the spinning industry in Ayabe City.
Some local industries in this region began during this period; for example bags produced within Toyooka City, which started with the product Salix koriyanagi, and the spinning industry in Ayabe City.

sen.j: 江戸幕府が倒されて明治政府が誕生すると、廃藩置県によって、かつての丹国は豊岡県に、青葉山 (京都府・福井県)以東は敦賀県になった。
sen.e: The Meiji Government, which came into being after the topple of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), abolished clans and establishment of prefectures; former Ninokuni became Toyooka Prefecture and the area east of Mt. Aoba became Tsuruga Prefecture.

The Meiji Government, which came into being after the the Edo bakufu was abolished (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), removed clans and established prefectures; former Ninokuni became Toyooka Prefecture and the area east of Mt. Aoba became Tsuruga Prefecture.

The Meiji Government, which came into being after the Edo bakufu was (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) abolished, removed clans and established prefectures; former Ninokuni became Toyooka Prefecture and the area east of Mt. Aoba (Kyoto and Fukui Prefectures) became Tsuruga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 京都・福井県 追加しました。ダブりを修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、1876年8月21日には、豊岡県と敦賀県は廃止され、山陽道沿線や中山道沿線の府県に編入された。
sen.e: However, on August 21, 1876, Toyooka Prefecture and Tsuruga Prefecture were abolished and joined Prefectures covering areas along the Sanyodo Road or the Nakasendo Road.
However, on August 21, 1876, Toyooka Prefecture and Tsuruga Prefecture were abolished and joined Prefectures covering areas along the Sanyodo Road or the Nakasendo Road.
However, on August 21, 1876, Toyooka Prefecture and Tsuruga Prefecture were abolished and joined prefectures covering areas along the Sanyodo Road or the Nakasendo Road.
sen.cmt: prefectures 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 富国強兵政策が執られた明治時代には、いままで寒村であった東舞鶴（舞鶴市東部）に舞鶴鎮守府が設置され、日本海沿岸の一大軍事拠点となり、軍都として急速に発展し、日本海側有数の都市圏を形成することとなった。
sen.e: Under the plan for promoting national prosperity and defense in the Meiji Period, Maizuru Navy Base was established in a once-isolated village of Higashi-Maizuru (eastern Maizuru City) and became one of the biggest military base along the coast of the Japan Sea, which contributed a rapid development as a military city and the creation of one of the leading urban areas of Japan-Sea side of Japan.

Under the plan for promoting national prosperity and defense in the Meiji Period, Maizuru Navy Base was established in a once-isolated village of Higashi-Maizuru (eastern Maizuru City) and became one of the biggest military base along the coast of the Japan Sea, which contributed to its rapid development as a military city and the creation of one of the leading urban areas of Japan-Sea side of Japan.

Under the plan for promoting national prosperity and defense in the Meiji period, Maizuru Chinju-fu (Maizuru navy base) was established in a once-isolated village of Higashi-Maizuru (eastern Maizuru City) and became one of the biggest military base along the coast of the Japan Sea, which contributed to its rapid development as a military city and the creation of one of the leading urban areas of Japan-Sea side of Japan.
sen.cmt: period小文字にしました。舞鶴鎮守府→Maizuru Chinju-fu (Maizuru navy base) としました（他ファイルと統一）。

sen.j: これと前後して、大阪市や京都市や敦賀市から舞鶴に向けての鉄道が敷設され、北近畿にも鉄道の敷設が進められた。
sen.e: With this development, a railroad was built from Osaka City, Kyoto city, and Tsuiruga City to Tsuruga: the railway was laid out in Kitakinnki.
With this development, a railroad was built from Osaka City, Kyoto city, and Tsuiruga City to Tsuruga: the railway was laid out in Kitakinnki.
With this development, a railroad was built from Osaka City, Kyoto city, and Tsuruga City to Maizuru; thus the railway was laid out in Kitakinki.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後には、特に高度経済成長期に太平洋ベルトから漏れたため、北近畿でも過疎化した地域が見られるようになった。
sen.e: Depopulation has bee found in some areas of Kitakinnki, because it does not belong to the Pacific Belt, a centers of rapid economic growth zone.
Depopulation has been found in some areas of Kitakinnki, because it does not belong to the Pacific Belt, a center of rapid economic growth zone.
Depopulation has been found in some areas of Kitakinki, because it does not belong to the Pacific Belt, a center of rapid economic growth zone.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、現在では舞鶴若狭自動車道の整備や、京都府が主導する工業団地の建設などが進められている。
sen.e: Now, however, the Maizuru Wakasa Express Way and Kyoto Prefecture-led industry parks are being built..
Now, however, the Maizuru Wakasa Express Way and Kyoto Prefecture-led industry parks are being built..
Now, however, the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway and Kyoto Prefecture-led industry parks are being built.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。不要なピリオドを削除しました。

tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に変更しました。
小タイトル用に変更しました。

sen.j: 原子力発電所

sen.cmt: plant 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 5基の原子力発電所が置かれているが、いずれも嶺南に立地する。
sen.e: All the nuclear power plant having 5 units are located in Ryonann.
All the nuclear power plant having 5 units are located in Ryonann.
There are five nuclear power plants, all of which are located in Reinan.
sen.cmt: 原文のとおりに修正しました。Reinan としました。

sen.j: 鞄
sen.e: Bag
Bag
Bag

sen.j: 舞鶴市に舞鶴鎮守府が設置されることになったため、鉄道は他の地方に比べて比較的早く整備されている。
sen.e: The transportation system in this region was developed earlier than other region, because Maizuru Navy Base was established in Maizuru City.
The transportation system in this region was developed earlier than other regions, due to the establishment of Maizuru Navy Base in Maizuru City.
The transportation system in this region was developed earlier than other regions, due to the establishment of Maizuru Chinju-fu in Maizuru City.

sen.j: 京都鉄道・阪鶴鉄道によって敷設された山陰本線と福知山線、旧日本国有鉄道によって敷設された舞鶴線と小浜線が、幹線として通っている。
sen.e: The railroads that run as trunk lines are the Sanin Main Line and the Fukuchiyama Line built by Kyoto Railway and Hankaku Railway Co. built, and the Maizuru Line and the Obama Line built by former Japanese National Railways.

Railroads that run as trunk lines are the Sanin Main Line and the Fukuchiyama Line built by Kyoto Railway and Hankaku Railway Co., as well as the Maizuru Line and the Obama Line built by former Japanese National Railways.

Railroads that run as trunk lines are the Sanin Main Line and the Fukuchiyama Line built by Kyoto Railway and Hankaku Railway, as well as the Maizuru Line and the Obama Line built by former Japanese National Railways.

sen.j: 高速道路は整備が遅れていたが、現在は舞鶴若狭自動車道が敦賀市方面と阪神方面を貫くとともに、山陰自動車道・京都縦貫自動車道が京都市方面と鳥取市方面を貫くべく建設中である（現在は宮津天橋立インターチェンジから舞鶴大江インターチェンジまでが開通）。
sen.e: Though building of expressways was slow, the Maizuru Wakasa Express Way was completed to connect Tsuruga City and Hanshin regions, and the Sanin Expressway and the Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway are being built to directly connect Kyoto City and Tottori City. (Now the section between the Miyazu Amanohashidate Interchangeand the Maizuru Oe Interchange opens.)

Though expressway construction was slow, the Maizuru Wakasa Express Way was completed to connect Tsuruga City and Hanshin regions. The Sanin Expressway and the Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway are being built to directly connect Kyoto City and Tottori City. (The section between the Miyazu Amanohashidate Interchangeand the Maizuru Oe Interchange is now open.)

Although expressway construction was slow, the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway was completed to connect Tsuruga City and Hanshin regions; the Sanin Expressway and the Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway are being built to directly connect Kyoto City and Tottori City (the section between the Miyazu Amanohashidate Interchange and the Maizuru Oe Interchange is now open).
sen.cmt: Expresswayとしました。"Though"→"Although"に変更しました。

sen.j: 又、北近畿豊岡自動車道が舞鶴若狭道春日インターチェンジ (兵庫県)より分岐し、氷上インターチェンジまで開通。
sen.e: In addition, the Kitakinki Toyooka Expressway branches off at the Maizuru Wakasa Express Way Kasuga Interchange (Hyogo Prefecture) and is open for service until Hikami Interchange.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition, the Kitakinki Toyooka Expressway branches off at the Maizuru Wakasa Express Way Kasuga Interchange (Hyogo Prefecture) and is open for service until Hikami Interchange.
In addition, the Kitakinki Toyooka Expressway branches off at the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway Kasuga Interchange (Hyogo Prefecture) and is open for service until Hikami Interchange.

sen.j: 2006年には和田山インターチェンジまで延伸し、播但連絡道路と連絡している。
sen.e: It extended to the Wadayama Interchange in 2008 to be connected with the Bantan renraku Road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It extended to the Wadayama Interchange in 2008 and connected with the Bantan renraku Road.
It extended to the Wadayama Interchange in 2006 and connected with the Bantan renraku Road.

tit.cmt: 他の記事ファイルと統一しました。
